On Turning 25

A Quarter Of a Century That Is

It’s a nice little Chrome plugin found here.

Incidentally this is my 100th article on the site as well. I cannot say I didn’t plan it to be this way though.

So today I turn 25. As every single birthday after the 22nd one is, this one is also special. The number didn’t matter when I was in the ‘teens’ but after grad school, every single one feels important, valuable and memory-bearer. So many things happened in the last year since I wrote this - good, bad and awesome. And I’m thankful for all of those for they helped shape me as a wee bit more experienced and a more mature person. This is my first birthday post-marriage and hence it’s a special one.

For those not in the know, this is the girl I spend my life with:

A photo posted by Hardik Pandya (@hvpandya) on Jun 6, 2014 at 7:58am PDT


Apart from that I managed to rake up a lot of travel-mileage this past year. We traveled a lot north, south and center. I even checked off an item off my bucket-list when I visited Ladakh a few months ago.

Royal Enfield atop Khardungla Pass. Legends are really true. It's a collector's edition. #ladakh #khardungla #india #travel

A photo posted by Hardik Pandya (@hvpandya) on Sep 9, 2014 at 2:45am PDT


So for this coming year in life, I do not have outrageous wishes, just the simple usual stuff. And I would be very satisfied if I managed to fulfill all of it.

  • Work even more.
  • Take even more photographs.
  • Travel even more.
  • Love even more.
  • Ditch anger.

Sand dunes of Jaisalmer #jaisalmer #rajasthan #travel #india

A photo posted by Hardik Pandya (@hvpandya) on Oct 10, 2014 at 3:10am PDT


There’s a great quote by C.S. Lewis,

Isn't it funny how day by day nothing changes, but when you look back, everything is different...

Live, don’t just exist. Years will go by anyway.

Published on November 19, 2014.

Epilogue

Thanks for reading the article! There's plenty more to read if you liked this one. My company also develops Octalbonescript and has open-sourced it. My work/interest aligns towards jQuery, Node.js, AJAX, AngularJS, front-end web-development and software-hardware system design.

For any questions on open-source hardware, software development and any other projects, reach out on hardik@hardik.org or tweet (@hvpandya) me.
